alert.note: Alert for Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 12:07PM EST until December 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following county, Onslow. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, New River Station, Pumpkin Center, Half Moon, Camp Lejeune Center, Piney Green, Swansboro, Kellum, Verona, Midway Park, Catherine Lake, Richlands South and Haws Run. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
